entry.title: Meth Dealer Arrested (Photo)
entry.summary:
On Wednesday, May 29th, 2024, detectives with the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team (DINT) culminated a months long investigation into illegal drug dealing in the Yoncalla area with the execution of search warrants at two locations and making an arrest.
In recent months, through varied investigative techniques, detectives obtained evidence of multiple suspected large scale drug deals occurring at a residence in the 600 block of Main Street in Yoncalla. During that time, detectives seized approximately two pounds of suspected methamphetamine that could be tied directly to the suspect, 54 year old Donald Wayne Baughman of Yoncalla.
On Wednesday afternoon, at approximately 3:45 PM, DINT, with assistance from the Douglas County Sheriff's Office, executed search warrants at two of the s…

entry.title: DINT arrests repeat drug offender in Myrtle Creek
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Detectives with the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team, known as DINT, arrested 52-year-old Randall Lee Slay, of Myrtle Creek, on multiple drug related charges Tuesday.

entry.title: Arrest of Habitual Drug Offender (Photo)
entry.summary:
In the evening hours of Tuesday, May 28th, 2024, detectives with the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team (DINT) once again arrested a habitual drug offender in the Myrtle Creek area. Detectives had been investigating the suspected illegal activities of 52 year old Randall Slay, of Myrtle Creek, and had developed reason to believe Slay was driving to a location in the area to make a drug deal.
With help from the Douglas County Sheriff's Office, a traffic stop was initiated on Slay and his vehicle in the 900 block of S. Main Street in Myrtle Creek. Douglas County Sheriff's Office K-9 “Trapper” was tasked to sniff Slay's vehicle for the odor of narcotics. Trapper gave the alert, indicating he had indeed smelled the odor of narcotics coming from the vehicle.
Detectives and a deputy located approximately 16.3 grams of suspected methamphetamine in Slay's possession. In a subsequent search of Slay's vehicle detectives found four more baggies containing various amounts of suspected methamphetamine. In total, from the traffic stop, detectives seized approximately 173 grams of suspected methamphetamine.
Shortly thereafter a search was conducted of Slay's residence. At the residence detectives located an additional approximate 134 grams of suspected methamphetamine and several items of drug paraphernalia to include scales, baggies, pipes, scoopers, etc.
Slay was lodged at the Douglas County Jail on the following charges:
Unlawful Possession of Methamphetamine Unlawful Delivery of Methamphetamine Unlawful Manufacture of Methamphetamine
In just the last two years, this is the third time Slay has been arrested by DINT.

An RPD report said the 24-year-old had allegedly stolen hundreds of dollars in merchandise on three different occasions from a business in the 2100 block of Northwest Stewart Parkway. The amount totaled more than $1,000 over the...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOLLOWING REPORTED ASSAULT INCIDENT
entry.summary: May 28, 2024 10:30 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man following a reported assault incident on Saturday night. An RPD report said 7:00 p.m. 36-year-old Robert George assumed a victim had his wallet and wanted it back. The incident took place in the 2300 block of Northeast Diamond Lake Boulevard. The victim did not have...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR ALLEGED DISORDERLY CONDUCT INCIDENT
entry.summary: May 28, 2024 10:20 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for an alleged disorderly conduct incident on Saturday. An RPD report said at 11:00 a.m. officers conducted a traffic stop with 33-year-old Nathaniel Creveston near the intersection of West Harvard Avenue and West Madrone Street. Creveston got out of his vehicle and reportedly displayed violent...

entry.title: TRANSIENT JAILED FOR STOLEN GOLF CART INCIDENT
entry.summary: May 28, 2024 10:00 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: A transient was jailed by the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office Sunday for a stolen golf cart incident. A DCSO report said at 11:30 p.m. a deputy stopped the golf cart near the intersection of Salmon Harbor and Lighthouse Road in Winchester Bay. The deputy learned the...

entry.title: WINSTON POLICE JAIL MAN FOLLOWING ALLEGED DISTURBANCE
entry.summary: May 28, 2024 9:40 a.m. Winston Police jailed a man following an alleged disturbance on Sunday. A WPD report said just before 5:00 p.m. officers were dispatched to the 100 block of Rouge Street regarding a disturbance. After an investigation, the 61-year-old was charged with 4th degree assault and harassment for reportedly throwing bleach in...

entry.title: WINSTON POLICE JAIL WOMAN FOR UNAUTHORIZED USE OF A MOTOR VEHICLE
entry.summary: May 28, 2024 9:30 a.m. Winston Police jailed a woman for unauthorized use of a motor vehicle on Monday. A WPD report said on May 22nd, at approximately 9:50 p.m. officers were dispatched to the 100 block of Rouge Street, regarding a stolen vehicle. A 32-year-old woman was reported to have borrowed the vehicle of...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 5.28.24

entry.title: Wyden visits Douglas County
entry.summary: REEDSPORT — U.S. Sen. Ron Wyden will hold an in-person town hall meeting Wednesday in Reedsport.

entry.title: Sheriff's office to hold medication take back
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Douglas County Sheriff's Office will host a free medication take back event from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. June 14 in the parking lot of the South Umpqua Fire Department, 400 S. Main St. in Canyonville.
